title: Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) engineering internship
summary: MHD-focused computational fluid dynamics (CFD) engineering internship in 2021 at the Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory.
demonstrates: Demonstrates knowledge of CFD and MHD principles with OpenFOAM (C++), ability to present technical material in written and oral format, and effective collaboratation in a professional environment.

title: CERN software design internship
summary: Web application created with OpenShift and NGINX to host detector calibration data for my 2022 internship at CERN.
demonstrates: Demonstrates user-oriented web and software development, ability to write technical documentation, and capacity to succeed in a professional environment.

title: Motion tracking video analysis
summary: Motion tracking and analysis script written in Python for a lab course at Cal Poly Humboldt.
demonstrates: Demonstrates video processing and data analysis with Python, creative implementation of custom algorithms, and ability to write technical reports.

title: Determination of g from pendulum measurements
summary: Evaluation of different methods for measuring gravitational acceleration using a pendulum for a lab course at Cal Poly Humboldt.
demonstrates: Demonstrates ability to design and construct lab experiments, analyze measurements and error sources, and clearly communicate technical information in writing.

title: Particle physics analysis course
summary: Course on particle physics data analysis with the C++ library ROOT taken in spring 2020.
demonstrates: Demonstrates knowledge of particle physics and special relativity, familiarity with C++ concepts such as pointers, and ability to analyze and interpret large datasets.

title: Procedural animation software
summary: A partially-complete Python mathematical animation engine conceptually inspired by Grant Sanderson's Manim library.
demonstrates: Demonstrates high-level object oriented programming in Python, graphics and video processing abilities, and creative application of mathematics to solve complex problems.

title: NHK podcast downloader
summary: Python script to collect and download audio news reports from the NHK's Easy Japanese series.
demonstrates: Demonstrates user-oriented software design, basic web scraping with Python, and the application of programming to real-world problems.

title: 2020 Mathematical Contest in Modeling entry
summary: Data analysis script contributed to my team's entry in the three-day 2020 COMAP Mathematical Contest in Modeling.
demonstrates: Demonstrates proficiency in data analysis with Python, ability to rapidly prototype solutions, and effective collaboration with peers.

title: Work porfolio website
summary: Work portfolio (this site) on GitHub Pages to host work samples for prospective employers.
demonstrates: Demonstrates basic front-end web design, organizational skills, and professionalism.

title: From-scratch fluid simulation code
summary: Basic incompressible fluid simulation written in C# using the Unity game engine.
demonstrates: Demonstrates first-principles knowledge of computational fluid dynamics, proficiency coding in C#, and intrinsic motivation to learn.

title: Assorted lab reports from electronics courses
summary: An assortment of reports from electronics-based lab course at Cal Poly Humboldt.
demonstrates: Demonstrates proficiency with electronic instrumentation and circuit analysis, communication of technical information in written reports, and ability to work both independently and cooperatively.

title: Light-sensitive robotic car
summary: Light-sensitive robotic toy car that backs away from light sources while emitting distressed noises, designed and constructed from scratch using electronics first principles.
demonstrates: Demonstrates hardware skills, proficient use of components such as transducers, transistors, and 555 timers, and creative application of electronics knowledge to novel problems.
